page.title: 13Bell's Whisky Loses Battle.
page.content: Until Friday 23rd August, Perth was the world headquarters and home of {Arthur Bell and Sons,}distillers of {Bell's Old Scotch Whisky}since 1825. Over the past{160 years}Bell's have contributed to the commercial and social life of Perth. The former by bringing business to the town and the latter by funding local{charities}and events; building{housing}for their employees at Gannochy and creating the large{Bell's Sports' Centre,}Cricket Pavilion and new tennis courts. After a bitter ten week struggle, the Irish brewers,{Guinness}succeeded in their takeover bid at a cost of Â£350m. Perth citizens must now wait to see what long term effects this change in ownership will have on them, if any. Sufficient to say we are seeing the {end of an era,}but Perth people will always have cause to{thank Bell's.
